com.intel.icecp.node.security.keymanagement.impl

Class KeyStoreBasedManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.icecp.node.security.keymanagement.impl.KeyStoreBasedManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KeyManager, AutoCloseable

    public class KeyStoreBasedManager
extends Object
implements KeyManager, AutoCloseable
    Implementation of key manager using Java KeyStore, which works ONLY with JCEKS format. This implementation uses two separate instances of KeyStore
    1. A key store contains all the keys, i.e., both node's keys and channel keys; this store can persist both public/private keys and symmetric keys;
    2. trust store contains the trust anchors X.509 certificates (e.g., administrator and/or CA); node's certificate (if any) goes here as well.
    Access control is performed on keys by key ID using SecurityUtils and the operations specified in KeyManagementPermissions class

      • getKey

        protected <T extends Key> T getKey(String keyAlias,
                                   Class<T> keyType,
                                   KeyStore keyStore)
                            throws KeyManagerException
        Utility method that fetches a key from a given KeyStore, and returns it in the following cases:
        1. The entry exists
        2. The entry is a key entry
        3. The key is of (or assignable from) the given Key type
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        keyAlias - Alias under which the key is stored inside the KeyStore
        keyType - Expected key type, as a subclass of Key
        keyStore - Key store
        Returns:
        The key if the above requirements are met
        Throws:
        KeyManagerException - In case of error

      • init

        protected final void init(KeyStore store,
                          char[] password,
                          Path path,
                          boolean acceptEmpty)
                   throws KeyManagerException
        Reads (and loads if necessary) a given KeyStore.
        Parameters:
        store - Reference to the key store to initialize
        password - Password to open the key store
        path - Path in the file system
        acceptEmpty - Tells whether is acceptable to load an empty key store
        Throws:
        KeyManagerException - If the given store name is not valid or if store loading or creation fails

      • write

        protected void write(KeyStore store,
                     String keyStoreLocation)
              throws KeyManagerException
        Writes on a given KeyStore; to use if we modified the key store and want to change its state. Note that, this method does NOT perform any permission check, which should be enforced by the caller
        Parameters:
        store - Key store
        keyStoreLocation - Key store location
        Throws:
        KeyManagerException - If the given store name is not valid or if writing in the key store fails

      • isSelfSigned

        protected boolean isSelfSigned(Certificate certificate)
        Tells whether a given Certificate is self signed.
        Parameters:
        certificate - The certificate to check
        Returns:
        true if the certificate is self signed; false otherwise

      • checkCertificateValidity

        protected void checkCertificateValidity(Certificate certificate)
                                 throws UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                        CertificateExpiredException,
                                        CertificateNotYetValidException
        Utility method that verifies the validity of a certificate; this method checks whether the certificate is a subtype of X509Certificate and only in this case, tries to verify the validity of the certificate
        Parameters:
        certificate - The certificate to verify
        Throws:
        UnsupportedEncodingException - If the certificate format is not supported
        CertificateExpiredException - If the certificate is expired
        CertificateNotYetValidException - If the certificate is not yet valid

      • getTrustedCertificate

        protected Certificate getTrustedCertificate(String certificateID)
                                     throws KeyManagerException
        Returns a certificate from the trust store ONLY if it is valid; throws an exception otherwise. If invalid, the method tries to remove it from the trust store.
        Parameters:
        certificateID - Certificate unique identifier
        Returns:
        The certificate corresponding to the given id
        Throws:
        KeyManagerException - If certificate not found inside the trust store, or the certificate is expired/not yet valid

      • verify

        protected List<Certificate> verify(List<Certificate> certificateChain)
                            throws KeyManagerException
        Given a (possibly unsorted) certificate chain returns the corresponding ordered certificates list if the chain can be verified against the trust anchors; throws an exception otherwise. Returned certificates are sorted according to: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/security/cert/CertPath.html
        Parameters:
        certificateChain - Certificate chain as a List of Certificate
        Returns:
        An ordered certificate chain
        Throws:
        KeyManagerException - If the certificate chain is not verified
